TopicTitle: How do you do rotating VTOL engines?

Articles.Content: I'm using IR, but the rotating/pivoting mounts, including the VTOL rotor, wobble too much to use them, at least with large engines attached.

There's nothing much that you can do aside from fine tuning of the rotatrons.

Try to attach just the engine with a fuel line to the actuator and keep the tank fixed to the rest of the vtol. Maybe it will wobble less.

Edited December 28, 2014 by Janos1986
Even without rotating them, just loading the plane and it sitting on the runway has them wobbling for a while until they settle down.
Try strutting everything up to the part of the joint that rotates to the rest of the ship? It should prevent the wobbling. I'm not sure if it matters if you strut the bit that rotates though.
The rotating IR part is what is wobbling. The attachment point is fine.
If you post a screenshot we might be able to help you more.
